yoruba_text: (b) Àwọn ìbéèrè wo la lè bi ara wa nípa irú ẹ̀mí tí à ń fi hàn?
english_text: (b) What questions might weaskourselves about the spirit we show?

yoruba_text: (b) Irú iṣẹ́ ìsìn ọlọ́wọ̀ wo ni yóò mú ayọ̀ wá fún wa?
english_text: (b) What kind of sacred service will bring us joy?

yoruba_text: (b) Bá wo ni Jèhófà ṣe bù kún Há nà síwá jú sí i?
english_text: (b) How did Jehovah further bless Hannah?

yoruba_text: (b) Kí ni ẹ̀jẹ́ tí Jèhófà ṣì máa san fún à wọn èèyàn rẹ̀?
english_text: (b) What commitment does Jehovah still have with regard to his people?

yoruba_text: (b) Àwọn ìbéèrè pà tàkì wo ni a lè béèrè?
english_text: (b) What pertinent questions may beasked?

english_text: (b) What timely advice did the apostle Paul give to the Christians in Jerusalem?

english_text: (b) What contrast does Jehovah see when he observes today's world?

english_text: (b) What methods did Saul use to persecute David?

english_text: (b) How do you feel about what Jehovah and Jesus have done for you?

yoruba_text: (b) Nínú ayé tuntun, àǹfà àní wo ni à wọn olóòótọ́ nínú ará yé yóò ní?
english_text: (b) In the new world, what prospect will faithful humans have?

english_text: (b) What should be our motive in choosing further education when that may appear necessary?

yoruba_text: Àkọsílẹ̀ ìtàn náà sọ fún wa pé: “Dafidi sì dìde, ó sì lọ, à ti gbogbo à wọn ènìyàn tí ń bẹ lọ́dọ̀ rẹ̀, lá tiBaaleti Juda wá, lá ti mú à pótí ẹ̀rí Ọlọrun ti ibẹ̀ wá...
english_text: The historical account tells us: “Then David and all the people that were with him rose up and went to Baale-judah to bring up from theretheark of the true God...

yoruba_text: 2 Dá fídì à ti gbogbo à wọn ọkùnrin tó wà pẹ̀lú rẹ̀ bá lọ síBaale-júdà kí wọ́n lè gbé Àpótí Ọlọ́run tòótọ́+ wá lá ti ibẹ̀, iwá jú rẹ̀ ni à wọn èèyàn ti ń ké pe orúkọ Jèhófà Ọlọ́run à wọn ọmọ ogun,+ ẹni tó ń jókòó lórí* à wọn kérúbù.
english_text: 2 Then David and all the men with him set out for Baʹal·e-juʹdahto bring up from there the Ark of the true God,+ before which people call on the name of Jehovah of armies,+ who sits enthroned above* the cherubs.

yoruba_text: Baaleile naa, tabi ẹni tí ó ni ọgbà à jà rà naa, ni Jehofa Ọlọrun, ọgbà à jà rà naa sì orílẹ̀-èdè Isirẹli.
english_text: Thehouseholder, or owner of the vineyard, is Jehovah God, and the vineyard is the nation of Israel.

yoruba_text: Níto rí ẹ kò gba ẹ̀mí ìsìnrú tí ó tún ń fa ìbẹ̀rù, ṣùgbọ́n ẹ̀yin gba ẹ̀mí ìsọdọmọ, ẹ̀mí tí ń mú kí a ké já de pé: 'Ábà, Baba!'”—Róòmù 8:14, 15.
english_text: For you did not receive a spirit of slavery causing fear again, but you received a spirit of adoption as sons, by which spirit we cry out: 'Abba, Father!'” —Romans 8:14, 15.

yoruba_text: Bí à pẹẹrẹ, kí Jésù tó jí Lá sárù dìde, ó “gbé ojú rẹ̀ sókè sí ọ̀run, ó sì wí pé: 'Baba, mo dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ rẹ pé o ti gbọ́ tèmi.
english_text: Before he resurrected Lazarus, for instance, “Jesus raised his eyes heavenward and said: 'Father, I thank you that you have heard me.

yoruba_text: baba-baba
english_text: ancestor

yoruba_text: baba-ń lá
english_text: forefather

yoruba_text: A óò túbọ̀ mọ̀ nípa Èṣù táa bá ṣà yẹ̀wò ọ̀rọ̀ tí Jésù sọ fá wọn tí ń kọ́ni ní ẹ̀kọ́ ẹ̀sìn nígbà ayé rẹ̀, ó sọ pé: “Lá ti ọ̀dọ̀ Èṣùbabayín ni ẹ ti wá, ẹ sì ń fẹ́ lá ti ṣe à wọn ìfẹ́-ọkà nbabayín.
english_text: We learn a lot about the Devil when we consider Jesus' words to religious teachers of his day: “You are from yourfatherthe Devil, and you wish to do the desires of yourfather.

yoruba_text: (1 Tímótì 6:9) Kí à wọn ọmọlẹ́yìn Jésù má bàa kó sínú ìdẹkùn yẹn, Jésù rán wọn létí péBabawọn tí ń bẹ lọ́run mọ̀ pé wọ́n nílò gbogbo nǹkan wọ̀nyí.
english_text: (1 Timothy 6:9) To help them avoid this “snare,” Jesus reminded his followers that their heavenly Fatherknew they needed all these things.

yoruba_text: Ètùtù, ìrawọ́ ẹ̀bẹ̀, à dúrà, à ti ìrúbọ ni à wọn oríṣiríṣi ọ̀nà tí à wọn alà àyè lè gbà ní à jọṣepọ̀ pẹ̀lú à wọnbabań lá wọn.”
english_text: Propitiation, supplication, prayer, and sacrifice are various ways in which the living can communicate with theirancestors.”

yoruba_text: Ní ọgọ́rọ̀ọ̀rún ọdún ṣá ájú ìgbà yẹn, à wọnbabań lá à wọn tó dèrò ìgbèkùn yìí kéde ìpinnu wọn pé à wọn yóò ṣègbọràn sí Jèhófà nígbà tí wọ́n sọ pé: “Kò ṣeé ronú kàn fún à wa, lá ti fi Jèhófà sílẹ̀ lá ti lè sin à wọn ọlọ́run mìíràn.”

yoruba_text: Ní kété tí ogun náà parí tí ìká lọ́wọ́kò nípa ìrìn-à jò sì rọjú, Pryce Hughes lá ti Beteli ti London wá síBelfast.
english_text: As soon as the war ended and travel restrictions were eased, Pryce Hughes from the London Bethel came to Belfast.

yoruba_text: Ọkùnrin kan nílùúBelfast, ní Àríwá orílẹ̀-èdè Ireland sọ pé kẹ̀kẹ́ tẹ́nì kan fún òun nígbà tó un wà ní nǹkan bí ọmọ ọdún mọ́kà nlá lẹ̀bùn tó un fẹ́ràn jù.
english_text: A man in Belfast, Northern Ireland, called a racing bike he received when he was 10 or 11 years old the best present ever.

yoruba_text: Northern Ireland, gẹ́gẹ́ bí apá kan United Kingdom, ń bá Germany jagun, níto rí náà bí a ti ṣílọ sí à ríwáBelfast, a nílá ti dojúkọ ọ̀ràn jíjá wèé ra oúnjẹ à ti ìṣúbolẹ̀ òkùnkùn nígbà tí iná bá lọ.
english_text: Northern Ireland, as part of the United Kingdom, was at war with Germany, so as we moved north to Belfast, we had food ration books and the blackout at night to contend with.

yoruba_text: Nígbà tí wọ́n déBelfast, à wọn ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́rin à tà àbọ̀ [450] ló wá gbọ́ à sọyé Ará kùnrin Russell, à wọn bí ọgọ́rùn-ún [100] nínú wọn ló sì dúró to rí pé wọn ò ríbi jókòó.
english_text: Brother Russell's public talk in Belfastdrew 450 locals, about 100 of whom had to stand because of a lack of room.

yoruba_text: Bí ó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ọkọ̀ òfúúrufú Nazi nílá ti rin ohun tí ó ju 1,600 kìlómítà kí ó tó lè déBelfastkí ó sì tún padà sí ibùdó wọn ní Europe, wọ́n gbìyà njú lá ti ju bọ́m̀bù sórí ìlú-ń lá náà lọ́nà tí ó gbéṣẹ́.
english_text: Although Nazi aircraft had to fly well over 1,000 miles [1,600 km] to get to Belfastand back to their bases in Europe, they managed to bomb the city effectively.

english_text: In 1999 the population of Belgiumwas aghast when it was reported that such items as eggs, poultry, cheese, and butter were possibly contaminated by a poison called dioxin.

english_text: From there I went to Belgium, where I took French classes and worked part-time in a restaurant.

english_text: Cherlin: “In Belgium, France, and Switzerland rates [of divorce] have doubled [since the 1960's], while in Canada, England, and the Netherlands they have risen threefold.”

english_text: For instance, in the 17th century, a Belgianchemist boasted that he had made mice appear by stuffing a dirty blouse into a jar of wheat!

english_text: As wasthe casein Jeremiah's day, the eternal God, Jehovah, continues to be the only Source of life-giving waters.

yoruba_text: Bótilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé mo mọ ojú pà tàkì tí Ọlọ́run fi ń wo ara èèyàn, síbẹ̀ mi ò yé ṣe é.”—Jennifer, ọmọ ogún ọdún.
english_text: I knew of God's high regard for the human body, but even this did not deter me.” —Jennifer, 20.

yoruba_text: Bóṣe wà nínú Ẹ́kí sódù 23: 9, bá wo ni Ọlọ́run ṣe fẹ́ ká wọn ọmọ Ísírẹ́lì máa ṣe sá wọn à jèjì, kí sì nìdí?
english_text: Accordingto Exodus 23:9, how were God's ancient people expected to treat foreigners, and why?

yoruba_text: Ó dá jú pébóo ṣe fi hàn pé ọ̀ràn wọn jẹ ẹ́ lógún máa wú wọn lórí.
english_text: No doubt they'll be pleased thatyoucare enough to ask about their life.

yoruba_text: (Diutarónómì 23:12-14)Bótiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé kò rọrùn fún wọn lá ti tẹ̀ lé à wọn òfin yìí to rí pé ibùdó náà tó bi, à mọ́ ó dá jú pé èyí ràn wọ́n lọ́wọ́ lá ti dènà à wọn à rùn bí ibà tá ífọ́ọ̀dù à ti kọ́lẹ́rà.
english_text: (Deuteronomy 23:12-14) This must have been a tiresome chore in view of the size of the camp, but it doubtless helped prevent such diseases as typhoid fever and cholera.

yoruba_text: A jọ sọ̀rọ̀ lórí bí Jésù ṣe jẹ́ Júù à ti lórí kókó náà pé, bótilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé Júù ni mí, mo ti di ọ̀kan lá ra à wọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà.
english_text: We talked about Jesus' being a Jew and about the fact that eventhough I was Jewish, I had become one of Jehovah's Witnesses.

yoruba_text: Ìṣòro kan tó lè máà jẹ́ ká ronúbóti yẹ ni dídá ara ẹni lójú jubóti yẹ lọ.
english_text: A threat to our ability to think straight is a tendency to beoverconfident.

yoruba_text: Ó sọ ọ́ di dandan fún mi lá ti máa bá bà bá mi lọ gbá boules (irú eré bọ́ọ̀lù kan nílẹ̀ Faransé), bótilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé mi ò fi bẹ́ẹ̀ nífẹ̀ẹ́ sí eré bọ́ọ̀lù yẹn.
english_text: She insisted that I play boules (a French bowling game) with him eventhoughit was not my favorite game.

yoruba_text: 8BóO Ṣe Lè Di Ọ̀kan Lá ra Àwọn Ọmọ Ọlọ́run
english_text: 8 Becoming One of God's Children

yoruba_text: Bótilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé iṣẹ́ òjíṣẹ́ alá kòókò kí kún ṣì ń wù mí gan-an, ọ̀nà wo ni mo fẹ́ gbé e gbà?
english_text: Although I still yearned to serve as a full-time minister, how could I do so?

yoruba_text: (Gá látíà 6:10; Ìṣe 16:14-18)Bótilẹ̀ rí bẹ́ẹ̀, à wọn Kristẹni tòótọ́ máa ń yà gò fún lílọ́wọ́ nínú ìjọsìn èké, títí kan ohunkóhun tó bá jẹ mọ́ ṣíṣà jẹ́.—2 Kọ́ríń tì 6:15-17.
english_text: (Galatians 6:10; Acts 16:14-18)Nevertheless, true Christians shun any involvement with false worship, including any form of witchcraft.—2 Corinthians 6:15-17.

yoruba_text: Bótilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé Mósè à ti Áá rónì ni wọ́n dojú ìrá hùn wọn kọ, Jèhófà wò ó pé òun Ọlọ́run gan-an ni wọ́n ń rá hùn sí.
english_text: Althoughtheir complaints were directed against Moses and Aaron, in Jehovah's eyes the real target of their discontent was God himself.

yoruba_text: Àfibóṣe di pé oko ọkùnrin ọlọ́rọ̀ kan tó ń jẹ́ Bóá sì ló ti rá yè pèéṣẹ́, Bóá sì sì jẹ́ mọ̀lẹ́bí Elimélékì ọkọ Ná ómì tó ti kú.
english_text: Shechanced upon the fields of a man named Boaz, a wealthy landowner and a relative of Naomi's dead husband, Elimelech.

yoruba_text: Ìwà Anna tún wú olùkọ́ náà lórí, ó sì gbóríyìn fun un níwá jú à wọn ọmọ kí lá àsì tó kù to rí pé ó jẹ́ ọmọlúwà bí à tibóṣe máa ń múra níwọ̀ntúnwọ̀nsì.
english_text: The teacher was also impressed with Anna's behavior, praising her in front of the whole class for her goodmannersand modest dress.

yoruba_text: Fún à pẹẹrẹ, òkìkí Nostradamus, awòrà wọ̀ tó jẹ́ ọmọ ilẹ̀ Faransé nì, ṣì ń kàn títí di ìsinsìnyí, bótilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ọ̀pọ̀ ọ̀rúndún ti kọjá tó ti kú.
english_text: For example, French astrologer Nostradamus continues to be popular, though hehas been dead for centuries.

yoruba_text: Kà kà bẹ́ẹ̀, ṣe lòun ń “wà lá àyè nìṣó”bótiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ipò tirẹ̀ yà tọ̀ sí ti ọ̀pọ̀ jù lọ èèyàn ìgbà ayé rẹ̀.
english_text: He survived Jerusalem's destruction, thoughhis personal situation was different from most.

yoruba_text: Bóyá o tiẹ̀ ti ń sọ lọ́kàn rẹ pé, 'Bóṣe dà bíi pé Jèhófà ò ṣe nǹkan kan nípa à dá nwò mi yìí, ǹjẹ́ èyí ò fi hàn pé kò mọ ohun tí mò ń dojú kọ tà bí pé kò tiẹ̀ bìkí tà nípa mi?'
english_text: Perhaps you wonder, 'Does the fact that Jehovah appears not to have done anything about my trial mean that he is unaware of my situation or that he does not care about me?'

yoruba_text: Pabanbarì ẹ̀ ni pé kò sẹ́ni tó máa sọ pé òun ò mọbóṣe máa ń ṣèèyàn nígbà téèyàn ẹni bá kú.
english_text: And who of us has not experienced deep pain and emptiness after losing a loved one in death?

yoruba_text: Bí à pẹẹrẹ, bóo bá ń fẹ́ ká wọn èèyàn máa fojú à gbà lagbà wò ẹ́, ìyẹn lè jẹ́ kó o bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí kọ à wọn ìlà nà rere tá wọn òbí ẹ fi tọ́ ẹ dà gbà sílẹ̀.
english_text: For example, the longing foryourown identity could drive you to turn against good values you've been taught at home.

yoruba_text: Bí èdè yìí ṣe máa ń dún téèyàn bá ń sọ ọ́, bóṣe jẹ́ pé ń ṣe là wọn fá wẹ̀lì tẹ̀ lé ara wọn (odidi fá wẹ̀lì má rùn-ún lè wà nínú ọ̀rọ̀ kan ṣoṣo), à tibóṣe jẹ́ pé ìwọ̀nba kọ́ń sónáǹtì díẹ̀ ló ní mú kó fẹ́ sú à wọn míṣọ́nná rì náà.
english_text: The exhaling sounds of the language interrupted by glottal stops, itsnumerous successive vowels (as many as five in a single word), anditsrare consonants drove the missionaries to despair.

yoruba_text: Bótilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ohun tó ṣe é yìí le gan-an, tí à wọn dókí tà kan sì sọ pé tí wọ́n ò bá fẹ́ kó kú, ó yẹ kí wọ́n fa ẹ̀jẹ̀ sí i lá ra, à wọn tó ń tọ́jú rẹ̀ sọ pé ohun tó kọ sínú ìwé yẹn là wọn máa tẹ̀ lé.
english_text: Although hiscondition was serious and some doctors felt that to save his life, blood transfusion was necessary, the medical staff was prepared to honor his wishes.

yoruba_text: Mo bẹ̀ ẹ́ pé kí ó bá mi tún à wọn ẹsẹ̀ mi tí ó ti rún gbé sípòbóti yẹ.
english_text: I asked her to adjust the position of my legs, astheywere mangled.

yoruba_text: Ẹnì kan tó nífẹ̀ẹ́ rẹ lè fòye mọ ohun tó wà lọ́kàn rẹ gan-an kó wá jẹ́ kó o mọ̀ pé lá ra ohun tó o máa kọ́ níléèwé nibóo ṣe lè ní ìforítì. Ó sì yẹ kó o ní ìforítì tó o bá máa fi gbogbo agbá ra rẹ sin Jèhófà.—Sm.
english_text: A person who loves you may discern your motives and help you to realize that school can help you to learn not to give up easily, a vital quality if you want to serve Jehovah fully. —Ps.
